intro: Schlimia condorana, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with a fine pubescence, while its stems are often branched and sturdy. Schlimia condorana is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows and cloud forests.
